column4: so ppl basically lying here? I just went through a re-install to check Uinity.
and get the error 'It seems that you don't have the hardvare to run unity defaulting to...'
I don't have an attitude, I just wanted to check unity.
by the way I am using qemu here.
earlier ppl swore to me that it'd work.
I'd love to try that if it works on qemu
in an unsupported ppa yes. use at your own risk
there's a ppa, search for it via ppa search on launchpad; as its a ppa, it's unsupported when things go wrong
here? https://launchpad.net/ which name should I search?
ppa search is hosted on launchpad yes
same way you add any other ppa; sudo add-apt-repository
there are instructions on the page
very. best to wait. check distrowatch.com or gnome homepage
lets take this non ubuntu support to #ubuntu-offtopic please
you are asking about fedora and gnome-shell. thats offtopic here. please take it there.
